column5: Here it is and like I said be forewarned. This thing is spreading like wildfire.   http://www.computerworld.com/action/articl...ticleId=9016420    This is no Bull.. Admins are having alot of fun right now I bet.....  Gerritt.
Heard about this one today on the news.Why do people have to be like that? Joe
Luckily no one is targeting Macs yet!
Twiddling my thumbs... tada tada tada, trojan virus malware what?
Good to know, thanks Gerritt.  Hows the new job going btw?  Joey
I thought Trojans protected against viruses, time to switch brands.
hahaha.. ..   thanks for the heads up gerrit..

Thanks gerritt,i wonder if that got into our workplace we had 2 computers go down in 2 days and ours in the office is now junk it cant be fixed its toast.  ..like i always say i never open anything i dont know, and thats what i tell julie as well to never ddo that i delete alot of stuff so i hope they can get this thing under control....thanks bud....cheers

I pulled a nasty like this one off my Dad's pc last weekend.  The obvious sign of infection was a blinking icon in the system tray that popped every three minutes advising that spyware had been found, and directing me to another site to buy anti spyware software.  Norton and AdAware couldn't see it.  If you find this, see if you can find a tool called SmitFraudFix, follow the instructions, all better now.
